properties.description: This form is used to enter "metadata" or descriptive information about your digital resource (such as your book or tiff image). For help on how to enter information, consult the how-to document on the CTDA web site Resources for Participants.
properties.title: CTDA Item MODS Form

properties.description: If you select "No", then this digital asset WILL NOT appear in the aggregated channel the Connecticut History Illustrated.
properties.title: Should This Appear in Connecticut History Illustrated?

properties.description: Select Yes if you would like this item to appear in a channel that aggregates geographic content.
properties.title: Should This Appear in the Geographic Channel?

properties.description: Use Your Local List or Try Searching Library of Congress Linked Authorities and Vocabularies
properties.title: Creator/Contributor Information (Recommended If Applicable)

properties.description: Select person, corporate. conference/meeting or family
properties.title: Name Type

properties.description: Examples are: "Smith, J.J. (John Jay), 1909-1998" or "University of Connecticut" or "Mayflower (Ship)". Omit quotes when entering data.
properties.title: Creator/Contributor

properties.description: Use LC Relator Terms. Examples include: Creator, Photographer, Artist. NOT USED FOR NAME SUBJECTS.
properties.title: Role (Use terms, Creator or Contributor, to distinguish role played)

properties.description: Select ONLY ONE from the drop down list. For Collection with multiple formats, select "mixed material".
properties.title: Resource Type (Required)

properties.description: Use Your Local List or Try Searching Getty's Art and Architecture Thesaurus. Examples include: photographs, administrative records, notes.
properties.title: Genre Term(s) (Recommended)

properties.description: Best practice is to add a W3CDTF date format or YYYY, or YYYY-MM or YYYY-MM-DD. You may qualify the date with "approximate", "inferred" or "questionable"
properties.title: Enter A Single Date

properties.description: Best practice is to add a W3CDTF date format or YYYY, or YYYY-MM or YYYY-MM-DD. You may qualify the date with "approximate", "inferred" or "questionable"
properties.title: Enter A Date Range

properties.description: Enter the form or medium. Examples include: black and white, color.
properties.title: Form/Medium (Optional)

properties.description: Enter the IANA MIME Type such as image/jpg, image/jp2, image/tiff, video/mp4, audio/mp3, application/PDF. Search IANA MIME Type List.
properties.title: Digital Format (Recommended)

properties.description: Enter whether the resource was digitized (reformatted digital) or born digital.
properties.title: Digital Origin (Required)

properties.description: Enter the historical or current address associated with this resource.
properties.title: Historic or Current Address (Optional)

properties.description: Enter the name of the parent collection
properties.title: Source (Recommended If Applicable)

properties.description: Select Your Institution

index.key: Bridgeport History Center, Bridgeport Public Library

options.index: Bridgeport Public Library, Bridgeport History Center

index.key: Hartford History Center, Hartford Public Library

options.index: Hartford History Center, Hartford Public Library

properties.title: Held By (Required)

properties.description: Use Your Local List or Try Search Library of Congress Linked Authorities and Vocabularies
Enter the coordinates corresponding to the smallest geographic area or the address provided.
properties.title: Coordinates

properties.description: Examples are: "Smith, J.J. (John Jay), 1909-1998" or "University of Connecticut" or "Mayflower (Ship)". Omit quotes when entering data.
properties.title: Name

options.hdl: Handle - DO NOT REMOVE OR ADD DATA HERE

properties.description: Select Your Institution. The Default is: No known copyright restrictions.

options.index: SELECT YOUR RIGHTS STATEMENT FROM THE DROP DOWN LIST

index.key: ©Bridgeport Public Library, Bridgeport History Center. All rights reserved. Images may be used for personal research or non-profit educational uses without prior permission. For requests to publish or exhibit, see Bridgeport History Center, Bridgeport Public Library.
Copyright and reproduction information available from the Connecticut Historical Society.
Reproduction and copyright information regarding this image is available from The Graphics Collection, The Connecticut Historical Society, Hartford.
All rights reserved by the Fairfield Museum and History Center. Please contact us for information about reproduction.
Copyright restrictions may apply to the use of this image. For more information or to obtain a photographic reproduction of this image, contact the Hartford History Center, Hartford Public Library.

options.index: Hartford History Center, Hartford Public Library

index.key: Copyright restrictions applying to use or reproduction of this image are available from Mystic Seaport.

properties.title: Rights (Required)

properties.description: Enter the name of the organization or person creating this MODS record
properties.title: Who Created This MODS Record?
